intro: Pereziopsis, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, often fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or yellow. The plants are usually found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They have a basal rosette of leaves and produce capsules as their fruit type. Pereziopsis species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
